intro: Randia macromera, commonly known as the large-fruited randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are fleshy, berry-like structures that contain multiple seeds.
